description.text:
Alta Cali 
"Rising out of the Bay like a phoenix, Alta Cali is that one-in-a-million occurrence, a chance meeting that would go on to become a musical institution and foundation of a new genre of music, "Rumba Esquina", a highly combustible mélange of Spanish Rumba, Afro-Cuban, Pop, Soul, Hip-hop, and Flamenco, dance and song, that could have only happened in Alta California.   Spanning generations, styles, cultures, and nationalities, the members of Alta Cali are a United Nations of musical firepower, a band comprised of bandleaders, who all have one thing in common. Connecting with audiences through a mutual love of song and dance performance, and finally, a loving musical family who are close both onstage and off.  This is the new face of Latin Music. A naturally occurring caldera, a message, of music, and love.  This, is ALTA CALI  Acclaimed vocalist, Orlando Torriente, from San Francisco's Mission District, currently a resident of East Oakland, brings gritty, emotional, moving stories of love, loss, and the triumph and influence of their his family of all colors through songs and music, including Corrido, Nueva Trova, and all with the energy of rumba, alternative, and Latin rock in both Spanish and English. This is true Latin street music.  The powerhouse talents of renowned flamenco guitarist Daniel Fries, Spanish guitar master Jean Paul Buongiorno, the tight innovative rhythms of Steve Hogan (bass), Valentino Peeps (drums), and Alexey Berlind (percussion) And Javier Navarette (Congas), set the stage for astonishing solo violin performances by Antonio Blea and Matthew Szemela.   But the best is still yet to come. The most innovative Flamenco dancer of her generation, Melissa Cruz, brings her legendary fiery footwork magic to the stage along with the beautiful Afro-Cuban, and Afro Haitian dance expressions of the talented Anya De Marie, with dance that combines Rumba, Sevillanas, soul, Afro-Haitian, and more.   This is a group that could only have happened here, as one sensory experience will prove. Alta California is a one-of-a-kind affair, offering an explosive and compelling cultural and musical event."

description.text:
Come celebrate the close of the April 2016  Zoo Labs Music Residency (ZLMR) with a live experience created by each of our resident teams during their 12-day residency here at Zoo Labs.  
April's #ZLMR residents are (drum roll please) :   Madame Gandhi 
OK Sweetheart 
Crashing Hotels 
Each day at the Zoo Labs Music Residency includes mentor sessions, meals, and a lot of time in our world-class recording studios. Our mentors guide, teach and motivate our residents to reach new heights, go to unexpected places, challenge conventional wisdom, and move past the ordinary to the exceptional. Our studio is a playground designed for exploration and expansion.

description.text: DYSTOPIA Presents "CAVERN CLUB! Featuring Zero Zero (UK) and Joey Mojo"  Take back your freedoms and join us for our Drum and Bass monthly right here in the East Bay - Dystopia, every fourth Friday in the heart of Oakland, California. Come get 'baptized' to the sounds of Drum & Bass champions from all over the sprawl and indoctrinated by the verses of our MC's!  APRIL equals COLOSSAL talent that we are pleased to welcome for our 68th installment.    ︻╦╤─ ︻╦╤─ FREE YOUR SELF on APRIL 22ND ─╤╦︻ ─╤╦︻   This month’s AUDIO CHAMPIONS:   ★ ZEROZERO (EVOL INTENT | BROKEN AUDIO | CHEEKY MONDAY | UK) ★  Soundcloud: https://soundcloud.com/zerozerodnb  Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/zerozerodnb/   ZeroZero is a Drum & Bass duo consisting of Sam from Jersey and Jesse from London, both based in Amsterdam working as Audio Engineers, Producers and DJs. With releases on labels such as; Evol Intent Recordings, Mindtech Recordings, Liondub, Soul Rebel and DJ residencies at Cheeky Monday and Vanguard Audio, as well as positions as Head Engineers at Amsterdam’s Red Bull Studios, the pair are constantly working on several different musical projects at once. Currently working closely with the bass prodigy Teknian, they have a number of tracks lined up for release in 2016 along with collaborations with other exciting producers that have yet to be revealed. Supported by artists such as Reso, Spor, Evol Intent, JFB, B Traits, Bachelors of Science, Dave Owen, Calculon, Champion, Skandandbass, Adi-J and receiving plays on BBC Radio 1 and 1xtra, ZeroZero are writing music that appeals to fans of all the various DnB sub-genres. Their sound is heavily influenced by their love for funk, deep basslines and technical sound design as well as the musicality you’d expect from a duo with a background in playing live instruments. ZeroZero have big plans for 2016 with releases forthcoming on labels such as ProgRAM, Broken Audio, Bass=Win and Code Recordings, forthcoming sample packs for Prime Loops, and shows booked in Holland, UK, USA, Mexico and Canada so far. Their 4 deck DJ sets are fast paced, combine all styles of DnB and are packed with their own exclusive tracks, bootlegs and edits, making them an exciting addition to any lineup.   ★ JOEY MOJO (SMOKIN TEES) ★   Soundcloud: https://soundcloud.com/joey-mojo  Mixcloud: https://www.mixcloud.com/JoeyMojo/  Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/djjoeymojo/   With over 15 years’ experience in DJing, Joey Mojo has taken the electronica scene by storm. He prides himself in his eclectic musical choices and DJing styles, playing anything from dubwise, jump up, bassline, liquid, jungle and reggae/dancehall, on two, but sometimes even three turntables. His incredible track selection, coupled with his high energy and intricate scratching, helped him land his most prestigious job, as DJ for the Cheech & Chong’s North American Tour. Even though that job has completed, he hasn’t slowed down and plays out as often as he can. Joey Mojo is currently residing in Los Angeles, California and working as an audio engineer.   ★ M27 (OUTLET | NICEONES | BABY DONKEY) ★  Soundcloud: https://soundcloud.com/m27  From his background in Los Angeles hip-hop culture, fuses the skill set of a classic turntablist with his love of euphoric 90s rave music. With a selection of roots hardcore and jungle, he cuts, chops, and serves jungle breaks on a pair of classic technics turntables and Vestax battle mixer. M27 moved to the Bay Area in late 2011 after a long stint in Los Angeles working with Futurebound Radio and the Back to Basics jungle monthly. M27 curates Ruff Tapes out of Oakland, California which is a D.I.Y. mix-tape and mix-cd label. Primarily focusing on underground rave music still being freshly mixed...from jungle,house,acid,hardcore,breakcore..to 89' revival, hip hop turntablism, breaks, noise and more. M27 is active across the state playing alongside fellow heavy hitters in the underground.   ★ MERAKI (OUTLET | OTD | SOUND SYSTEM SYNDICATE) ★  Soundcloud: https://soundcloud.com/merakidj  Meraki touched wax for the first time when he was 12 years old and since has been blessed to share music in the majority of states in the USA. Meraki has a wide spanning passion for mixing that reaches far beyond any one musical genre or dance floor. He was born into a family of musicians and approached mixing music as something musical and applies many aspects of key theory as well as phrasing into his mixing style. Meraki has been able to support artist such as; The Crystal Method, Gridlok, Maztek, Shiny Toy Guns, Tritonal, Calvertron, Gammer, Dj S3rl, Figure, Bare, and Dj Impact (UK) to name a few.   ★ M.DAMNage (TOUCH BASS) ★  Soundcloud: https://soundcloud.com/mikedamnage   Rockin Heavy, Phat, Grimey Bass Rhythms from the heaviest hitters in Drum & Bass and Dubstep. Holdin’ it down for San Jose, California. Accolades and Affiliations: Touch Bass San Jose CA, REWIND San Jose CA, Something Sick San Jose CA, Genocide Sessions/Recordings US, Suicide Sessions UK, DarkWax Radio UK, Dystopia Oakland CA, Primitive Science Bay Area CA, 444 DNB Tracy CA. Much respect to all of the preceding for constantly supporting and keeping Drum & Bass alive and hard kickin'.   ★ R3M (DYSTOPIA | FOUNDATION) ★  Soundcloud: https://soundcloud.com/djr3m     ▲★▼★▲★▼★▲★▼★▲★▼★▲  21+ with valid ID 9pm - Bonetone $5  Happy Hour until 10p: $3 Drafts/$4 Wells.  ︻╦╤─ ︻╦╤─ ︻╦╤─  It's all going down at: Lounge 3411 3411 MacArthur Blvd Oakland, CA 94602  ***NOTE: PLEASE RESPECT THE VENUE AND DO NOT GRAFFITI OR PUT STICKERS UP***   ✣|✣|✣| Don't forget to add us|✣|✣|✣ http://facebook.com/dystopia510 http://twitter.com/dystopiaoakland   You can also check out http://www.511.org/ for your public transportation needs.  ✣|✣|✣|Checkout these AWESOME videos|✣|✣|✣  http://vimeo.com/53660187 http://vimeo.com/40435041    ★✣★★✣★ 2016 EVENTS ★✣★★✣★  ✔ FOUNDATION | FEATURING TOKEN + INDIDJINOUS + R3M + CORRINE + MERCEE + SUPADJERA + INFUSION + RUSS MACK + BASTIENGOAT | JANUARY 8TH, 2016 ➲https://www.facebook.com/events/148345398862700/ ✔ DYSTOPIA | 5-YEAR ANNIVERSARY FEATURING SINISTARR + MADAM BLISS + ADEPT + DAVESIMON + R3M | JANUARY 22ND, 2016 ➲https://www.facebook.com/events/1506410692988166/ ✔ FOUNDATION | FEATURING METHOD ONE + GALAXI + CORRINE + MAC SABBATH + CTHULHU BROTHERS DNB + KRAKINOV + STONE CACTUS + SAMSQUATCH + FLASH PONY TRILLIONARE$ | FEBRUARY 12TH, 2016 ➲https://www.facebook.com/events/884057341692437/ ✔ DYSTOPIA | SAMURAI MUSIC NIGHT FEATURING HOMEMADE WEAPONS + SHADOW SPIRIT + DJ TROMA + NO-SE + MERCEE | FEBRUARY 26TH, 2016 ➲https://www.facebook.com/events/1674589552811331/ ✔ FOUNDATION | RAY UPTOWN + MC ELIJAH DIVINE + THE DOCTOR + AUTOPSY + CORRINE + R3M + NEBAKANEZA + MISS HAZE + DANNY WEIRD + GUIDANCE | MARCH 11TH, 2016 ➲https://www.facebook.com/events/1101095339940838/ ✔ DYSTOPIA | THE FUTURE SOUND OF AMERICA FEATURING SUBMORPHICS + ZERE + RICKY SWITCH + JOE MOUSEPAD + QUALAFOX + R3M | MARCH 25TH, 2016 ➲https://www.facebook.com/events/1149692375071493/ ✔ FOUNDATION | AUDIO1 + CHRIS THE JUNGLIST + MAC SABBATH + HANDSOME DODGER + CORRINE + CARLOS ALFONSO + INFUSION + SONNY DAZE + RUSS MACK + DILT + BARE KNUCKLES | APRIL 8TH, 2016 ➲https://www.facebook.com/events/1700515116894135/

OUR Mission is to Uplift and Build A Community... 
Please be encouraged to bring your biz cards and tell your friends...

name.text: Stevie J Hosting Buff & Sexy In Oakland Friday April 29th (9pm-1:45am)
name.html: Stevie J Hosting Buff & Sexy In Oakland Friday April 29th (9pm-1:45am)

description.text:
Biography 
Steven A. Jordan (born November 2,) better known by his stage name Stevie J, is an American musician, record producer, songwriter and television personality born in Buffalo, New York. 
One of the more successful record producers of the mid-to-late 1990's, Jordan won three Grammy Awards in 1998 for his work on Puff Daddy's debut album No Way Out and produced for a number of artists including Mariah Carey, The Notorious B.I.G., 112, Jodeci, Faith Evans, Jay-Z, and Eve.  
Steven A. Jordan was born on November 2,  in Buffalo, New York. He grew up in Rochester, New York[3][ where he was raised by his father after his mother abandoned the family.  
Career  
Jordan first rose to fame as a member of Bad Boy Records' "Hitmen" roster of in-house producers and writers during the 1990s. He worked often with label owner Sean "Puffy" Combs, producing on several Bad Boy projects, such as the self-titled debut album of R&B quartet 112. Jordan produced their lead single "Only You" featuring The Notorious B.I.G..[8] Jordan produced several records on Notorious B.I.G.'s Life After Death album, such as "Mo Money Mo Problems", "Nasty Boy", "Notorious Thugs" (featuring Bone Thugs-N-Harmony), "Another", "You're Nobody (Til Somebody Kills You)", and "Last Day". Jordan went on to win a Grammy Award for production work on Combs' No Way Out album, most notably the Notorious B.I.G. tribute song, I'll Be Missing You. Outside of his association with Bad Boy, he has also produced for artists including Mariah Carey, with whom he was nominated for a Grammy Award for the contribution on her album Butterfly (1997). From the album, he produced songs like "Honey" (the album's lead single), "Breakdown" (featuring Bone Thugs-n-Harmony), "Babydoll", and for Carey's #1's (1998) "I Still Believe" and "Theme from Mahogany (Do You Know Where You're Going To)". In the summer of 1997, three of the aforementioned Stevie J-produced records (I'll Be Missing You, Mo Money Mo Problems, and Honey) topped the Billboard Hot 100 consecutively from the chart weeks of June 14 through September 27, 1997. He has also produced forBeyoncé, Jay-Z, Brian McKnight, Ma$e, Lil' Kim, Deborah Cox, Tamia and Tevin Campbell. Jordan also co-wrote the 2001 hit single "Let Me Blow Ya Mind" for Eve, who he was dating at the time. 
Prior to joining Bad Boy Records, Stevie J often performed with Jodeci as one of their live musicians, playing the bass guitar.[10] Stevie also appeared on their 1995 album The Show, The After Party, The Hotel.Jordan was a member of Swing Mob, a Rochester, New York-based record label and music compound founded by Jodeci member DeVante Swing. After Swing Mob folded and Jordan signed with Bad Boy, he continued a working relationship with Swing's younger brother and fellow Jodeci member Dalvin DeGrate, producing and singing on DeGrate's solo debut album, Met.A.Mor.Phic (2000).  
In 2012, Stevie J began appearing as a primary castmember of the VH1 reality TV series, Love & Hip Hop: Atlanta, which featured him involved in a love triangle involving his then girlfriend, Mimi Faust, and Puerto Rican rapper Joseline Hernandez.  
Since the show premiered in 2012, Jordan and Hernandez have become a popular couple in the hip-hop world, making cameo appearances in music videos such as former labelmate Faith Evans' "I Deserve It", featuring Missy Elliott and Sharaya J and Trey Songz's Hail Mary, featuring Young Jeezy and Lil Wayne. 
Jordan announced that he will be producing and starring in a movie "That Time of the Month" which is set to be released by the end of the year.  
Music Supllied by DJ Rick Lee of 106Kmel 
The notable bay area musical gegius who has mastered product and make several hits song among the bayarea Artist. He is current number 1, Dj for 106 Kmel loacted in San Francisco California. His musical sound attrcat divers grown and hard working professional. There is no dull monet when sbcDJ Rick lee is in the Turn table. he has been Deejing for the past 20 years. He will be bring his vast expereience in musical work to make Buff & Sexy one the most Sexiest and Classy event you have seeing. You don't to miss this Great event Friday April 29th, Stevie J of Love and Hip Hop of Atlanta and Grammy winning Artist Hosting Buff & Sexy live for the very first time in Oakland. We hope to see you there. 
 
  
  
The ticket sales are final and non refundable and nontranferable. 
  
SkyTeam,2016

name.text: Carnatic at Starline: Gautam Tejas Ganeshan & New Directions in I.C.M.
name.html: Carnatic at Starline: Gautam Tejas Ganeshan & New Directions in I.C.M.

description.text:
Carnatic at Starline: 
Gautam Tejas Ganeshan & New Directions in Indian Classical Music 
[ gautamtejasganeshan.com ] 
Doors at 1:30 / Show at 2:00 $10 online / $15 - $20 sliding scale at the door  
  

 
Gautam Tejas Ganeshan's authentic voice and intelligent approach breathe new life into an old tradition. His concerts reflect a traditional aesthetic, embracing a classical style instantly recognizable to aficionados worldwide, and transforming it through the creation of an ongoing body of original works based in love and understanding of Carnatic music - its elaborate structures, extensive improvisations, and the utmost sincerity that distinguishes its greatest practitioners.
 
He has performed widely in the SF Bay Area since 2004, including at the SFMOMA, BAM/PFA, SFJAZZ, Asian Art Museum (SF), Hertz Hall at UC Berkeley, and more, as well as having given workshops at the San Francisco Conservatory of Music and Stanford Jazz Workshop, and guest-lectures for music courses at UC Berkeley and UC Santa Cruz.

 

 
"Vocalist Gautam Tejas Ganeshan frees carnatic vocal virtuosity to access its angular outer reaches... An unflinching, intelligent intensity... Sophisticated technique and powerful repertoire."
 - SF International Arts Festival
 "Thoughtful, ecstatic vocal style... New music from an old tradition."
 - SFJAZZ
 "Subversive... Affecting and bold... The violinist and mridangam players played off, mimicked, and seemed to challenge one another during the group's two-hour set, which also included free-form solos. At times Ganeshan seemed to be shaking his head in agreement..."
 - East Bay Express
 "A magnet for local Indian classical musicians."
 - SF Chronicle
 "Ganeshan shared five of his alluring sets of lyrics [with] vocal ornamentations, involving trills and glissandos... Ganeshan's instrument was neither strong nor showy, but rather eminently lyrical and supple, its dramatic impact bolstered by the singer's expressive use of his arms and hands. A local treasure... A unique act... "
 - SF Classical Voice
 "A stunning performer... There's something raw and immediate about the music."
 - Long Beach Press Telegram

name.text: Martha Soledad VIP Album Release Party
name.html: Martha Soledad VIP Album Release Party

description.text:
Estoy muy contenta porque por fin compartire con todos los que me apoyan lo que mas me gusta hacer... componer y cantar! Soy Mexicana y desde chica he admirado la banda y la musica norteña y por fin, el primero de Mayo combinare mis pasiones y realizare una de mis metas. 
Se que los que me acompañaran lo haran porque creen en mi y porque en alguna ocasión y de alguna manera yo he echo lo mismo por ellos. Aun mas- mi circulo que amigos y conocidos son pura chulada y la verdad, todos juntos en un mismo lugar apoyándonos es el comienzo a mas asociaciones... 
Ya tengo el lugar, la musica y las ganas... asi que solo faltas tu!  
No quiero que el costo del evento o no tener a nadie quien te cuide los ninos sea motivo de tu aucensia- mandame un mensaje para darte un codigo. Necesito aplausos mas que dinero!!! 
Los fondos recaudados de este evento seran utilizados para continuar la creacion de una aplicacion mobil (de telefono) que ayudara a personas como tu y como yo a llegar a nuestra meta profesional o simplemente a un trabajo con mejor pago y beneficios- www.madebos.com.  
Besos mi gente bonita. Los quiero!!!! 
Martha Soledad

description.text:
**1st FRIDAY CRUISE PARTY*** 
From 10pm to 1am  Are you looking for something new on the First Friday's party menu?  If so we've got that covered for you!  Join iVM1 Entertainment as we present First Fridays On The Bay, a place where the GROWN & SEXY can mix mingle and get their groove on all night long!   So get ready to hop aboard as we cruise from the Bay to the City, and party under the stars.  But while you're cruising, you'll be grooving as Dj Ball-D keeps the boat  rocking, with the latest and greatest hits to keep those speakers knocking.  The cost for this event is $25 at the dock, so get there early to lock in your spot.   As always the event is for the GROWN & SEXY crowd so there will be no drama allowed.   Loading time will be at 9:40pm.  Embarcadero and Broadway  Behind Plank's   Jack London Sq N Oakland   FOLLOW ME ON I.G  CAPTNBLAKE    Hope to see you on deck! 
  
  
We "MUST" leave on time and keep on schedule folks. The boat will not wait for you so please arrive extra early to get good parking and familiarize yourselves with the area. There are big parking lots in the Jack London Square area close to our departing place, and public parking on the streets, but can be busy with the many restaurants and shops so please prepare. There are many places to eat & drink by the nearby boat boarding location after you park so coming early is highly recommended to situate yourselves, avoid any stress, and grab a drink or a bite to eat in this beautiful area while you're waiting.    ((( BOAT DEPARTURE ADDRESS ))) ~>>> 1 BROADWAY, OAKLAND, CA 94607  
...in the Jack London Square (area of Oakland) at the very end of Broadway Street (also next to Lungomare restuarant - in case you need another reference).   
*Boat returns at 1:00am.   *Please remember to bring your PHOTO ID's to be checked thru security and for ticket purchase confirmation. Please bring your ticket print-outs (if possible). *If you have bought multiple tickets, please have these persons with you on arrival before entering the boat to avoid confusion! This is a 21+ event.  About the boat: "Bay Celebrations" is a locally owned, double decked riverboat style vessel powered by twin engines. The boat is wheel chair accessible and features a full bar and indoor / outdoor areas. The boat moves slowly for maximum comfort and will tour the lovely waters of the SF Bay with viewings of the Bay Bridge, Golden Gate Bridge, and Alcatraz. This boats' capacity is 145 people.  *We highly recommend that you eat a good full meal before arriving to the boat keep your tummies full during the entire boat ride. Alcohol on an empty stomach is no bueno! There will many beverages (water, alcohol, soda, juice, etc.) sold at the 2 boat bars. We strongly suggest bringing a thick jacket as it can get chilly & windy during the evening hours and out on the deck. No backpacks and only good vibes on this journey... Let's have some fun!  Please 'like" our public facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/baycelebrations/?ref=hl  
Feel free to join our facebook group for what's next for what's next https://www.facebook.com/baycelebrations/?ref=hl 
Here is our website events and more infomation http://www.baycelebrations.com/

*Boat returns at 1:00am.

*Please remember to bring your PHOTO ID's to be checked thru security and for ticket purchase confirmation. Please bring your ticket print-outs (if possible). *If you have bought multiple tickets, please have these persons with you on arrival before entering the boat to avoid confusion! This is a 21+ event.

About the boat: "Bay Celebrations" is a locally owned, double decked riverboat style vessel powered by twin engines. The boat is wheel chair accessible and features a full bar and indoor / outdoor areas. The boat moves slowly for maximum comfort and will tour the lovely waters of the SF Bay with viewings of the Bay Bridge, Golden Gate Bridge, and Alcatraz. This boats' capacity is 145 people.

*We highly recommend that you eat a good full meal before arriving to the boat keep your tummies full during the entire boat ride. Alcohol on an empty stomach is no bueno! There will many beverages (water, alcohol, soda, juice, etc.) sold at the 2 boat bars. We strongly suggest bringing a thick jacket as it can get chilly & windy during the evening hours and out on the deck. No backpacks and only good vibes on this journey...
Let's have some fun!

description.text:
((WORD)) 80s,90s & New S**T                                                                                                                                   Bay Area Legends MIND MOTION & Chuy Gomez                                                                                           Residents Mr. E & UMAMI 
Table Reservations at 510 730-6104 (Melanie) 
About NINA SKY 
The number two is powerful. Not only does it signify Nina Sky’s tag teaming force, it also signifies the culmination of their independent EP release, Nicole & Natalie.  Since their global recognition in 2004 with the reggae-infused pop jam, 'Move Ya Body,' Nicole and Natalie Albino have spent a decade challenging their voices and learning more about themselves in life and in business. “ Just because we weren’t in the spotlight doesn’t mean we weren’t making moves,” Natalie explains. “These last 8 years were spent traveling, doing shows all over the world, writing and working with other artists. We’ve really had time to mature into women and master our craft.

description.text:
**COCKTAIL CRUISE PARTY*** 
Are you tired of the same old midweek entertainment?  
Join Party Boat "Bay Celebrations" every Thursday night for our Happy Hour Cocktail Cruise. 
The cost is $20per person, and yes there will be $5 drink specials designed just for you. 
Come have some great times with us once again on this beautiful boat cruise over the bay area waters, while we get our boogie on to some great music, meet, great, & vibe with good folks, see the many wonderful surrounding sights, travel under Bay Bridge's and enjoy this wonderful excursion on SF Bay! 
**Boat departs at "8:15PM SHARP!!" 
We "MUST" leave on time and keep on schedule folks. The boat will not wait for you so please arrive extra early to get good parking and familiarize yourselves with the area. There are big parking lots in the Jack London Square area close to our departing place, and public parking on the streets, but can be busy with the many restaurants and shops so please prepare. There are many places to eat & drink by the nearby boat boarding location after you park so coming early is highly recommended to situate yourselves, avoid any stress, and grab a drink or a bite to eat in this beautiful area while you're waiting.    ((( BOAT DEPARTURE ADDRESS ))) ~>>> 1 BROADWAY, OAKLAND, CA 94607  
...in the Jack London Square (area of Oakland) at the very end of Broadway Street (also next to Lungomare restuarant - in case you need another reference).   
*Boat returns at 10:15pm.   *Please remember to bring your PHOTO ID's to be checked thru security and for ticket purchase confirmation. Please bring your ticket print-outs (if possible). *If you have bought multiple tickets, please have these persons with you on arrival before entering the boat to avoid confusion! This is a 21+ event.  About the boat: "Bay Celebrations" is a locally owned, double decked riverboat style vessel powered by twin engines. The boat is wheel chair accessible and features a full bar and indoor / outdoor areas. The boat moves slowly for maximum comfort and will tour the lovely waters of the SF Bay with viewings of the Bay Bridge, Golden Gate Bridge, and Alcatraz. description.text: Dystopia Drum & Bass presents an extraordinary gathering experience in the heart of downtown Oakland’s newest venue. Dystopia is Oakland’s premiere Drum & Bass monthly every 4th Friday at Lounge 3411. We are dedicated to joining forces with local crews to generate memorable nights of auditory satisfaction. Foundation 10.0 is here and occurs at BRIX 581 every 2nd Friday of the month.  The SOUND SYSTEM is guaranteed to TIP the Richter Scale on this one!    ▼★PATIO★▼   ➤ DYSTOPIA FEATURING   http://www.facebook.com/dystopia510    ★ THE CENOBITES (FLEX | SOUND SPHERE | AMMUNITION) ★  Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/TheCenobites/  Soundcloud: http://soundcloud.com/TheCenobites  2016 marks 10 years of The Cenobites....  The Cenobites have released over 20 tunes on 15 different record labels including Flex Industries , Sound Sphere, Future Sickness, Ammunition, Zardonic Recordings, Digital 6, Koldfront, Mindocracy, and Multikill.... The Cenobites show no sign of slowing down, working with artists like, Jae Kennedy, Pish Posh, Sage, 6blocc, Freqax, Space Journey, Liminal, Glitch, Night Breed and Knoxz. Expect loads of sick tunes crossing all styles of drum and bass, Very technical dj sets, Double drops, Clean mixes with loads of unreleased and original tunes.   ★ ROBIN WEBER (SHELTER SF | IN2IT | FATBOL CLOTHING) ★  Soundcloud: https://soundcloud.com/robin-weber  Mainstay in the Bay Area Drum and Bass Scene. Founder of IN2IT Drum and Bass. Shelter SF Drum and Bass Crew Resident. Representing Fatbol Clothing.   ★ HANDSOME DODGER (DYSTOPIA | FOUNDATION | BABY DONKEY) ★  Soundcloud: https://soundcloud.com/handsomedodger   ★ CORRINE (DYSTOPIA | SHELTER | BITCH PLZ!) ★  Soundcloud: https://soundcloud.com/bitchplzbeats https://soundcloud.com/corrineisadj   ★ R3M (DYSTOPIA | FOUNDATION) ★ Soundcloud: https://soundcloud.com/djr3m     ▼★UPSTAIRS★▼   ➤ GALAXY UNKNOWN FEATURING    ★ SAUSEE (GALAXY UNKNOWN | GOA) ★  Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/DJSausee/  Soundcloud: http://www.soundcloud.com/sausee  https://soundcloud.com/bud-vapor  Mixcloud: www.mixcloud.com/Sausee   ★ DOCTORSPOOK (GEOMAGNETIC | OVNIMOON) ★  Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/DJ.DoctorSpook/ Soundcloud: https://soundcloud.com/doctorspook-geomagnetic  Also known as Nathan Vogel, Spook is an award winning 3D animator and music video director. He began creating psychedelic visuals in 1992, receiving critical acclaim for all of his projects. Nathan has worked with major music labels such as Arista, Geffen/Universal, Sony, Om and now with all of the most prominent Psy-trance labels with ground breaking new releases. Spooks passion for electronic music drove him to start making music in 1990. He began DJing Psy-trance at the Burning Man festival in 1998 and since has toured the world and shared the stage with the biggest names in dance music.   ★ MICHAEL LIU (PISCES | ILLUMINATION) ★   ★ PENGUIN ★   ★ WARRIOR OF LIGHT ★    ★★★MC APPARENTLY THE OBVIOUS ONE★★★   21+ With Valid Identification. 9pm - Bonetone. $5 Before 10pm/$10 Afterwards  ︻╦╤─ ︻╦╤─ ︻╦╤─  It's all going down at BRIX 581 581 5th Street  Oakland, CA   NOTE: PLEASE RESPECT THE VENUE AND DO NOT GRAFFITI OR PUT STICKERS UP  ✣|✣|✣| Don't forget to add us|✣|✣|✣ http://facebook.com/dystopia510 http://twitter.com/dystopiaoakland  You can also check out http://www.511.org/ for your public transportation needs. description.text:
#SUSHISUNDAY :A NEO SOUL SESSION 
SEASON OPENER  
SUNDAY APRIL 10, 2016 
4:00PM - 10:00PM 
  
$15 COVER CHARGE 
NO COVER BEFORE 5:00PM ON EVENTBRITE GUEST LIST: http://sushisunday.eventbrite.com 
DRESS CODE: FASHIONABLE (Enforced) 
SOUNDS BY: CHUY GOMEZ, DJ HECTOR,  CHRISDOPE   
LOCATION: Ozumo: 2251 Broadway Oakland, CA 
#SUSHISUNDAY - A NEO SOUL SESSION: Taking place once a month, this affair is designed to cater to mature adults 30 and over with a more discerning taste in their choice of nightlife. The ambiance of a day party, elegance of fine dining, excitement of a concert, with just enough capacity for that subtle turn-up! Our guest enjoy a day of relaxation and social conversation with other individuals who share the same objective....rejuvenation on a Sunday afternoon which includes subtle vibes, live music, DJ's, light cocktails, and tasty appetizers all in time enough to get home and recharge for the week. 
MUSIC GENRE: Neo Soul & R&B Classics ~ Neo Soul (also known as Nu Soul) is a marketing term for a sub-genre of contemporary Soul & R&B music. The music is usually a hybrid of 1970's-influenced soul music with influences from jazz, funk, Latin, African, hip hop and house music. The term "neo soul" was originated by Kedar Massenburg of Motown Records in the late 1990's. 
LOCATION: Ozumo (OAKLAND) 
Innovative and contemporary, Ozumo's cuisine is offered in an elegant, modern Japanese design-inspired restaurant located in the heart of Oakland's Uptown District. This sleek and sophisticated space boasts Oakland's largest sushi bar, a traditional robata grill, an alluring dining room and sake lounge as well as three private dining rooms and chef counter seating. An extensive offering of proprietary sakes, wine and signature cocktails complement the menu, making this a destination for connoisseurs of libations as well as discerning epicurians.

Our guest enjoy a day of relaxation and social conversation with other individuals who share the same objective....rejuvenation on a Sunday afternoon which includes subtle vibes, live music, DJ's, light cocktails, and tasty appetizers all in time enough to get home and recharge for the week.

MUSIC GENRE: Neo Soul & R&B Classics ~ Neo Soul (also known as Nu Soul) is a marketing term for a sub-genre of contemporary Soul & R&B music. The music is usually a hybrid of 1970's-influenced soul music with influences from jazz, funk, Latin, African, hip hop and house music. The term "neo soul" was originated by Kedar Massenburg of Motown Records in the late 1990's.

LOCATION: Ozumo (OAKLAND)

Innovative and contemporary, Ozumo's cuisine is offered in an elegant, modern Japanese design-inspired restaurant located in the heart of Oakland's Uptown District. This sleek and sophisticated space boasts Oakland's largest sushi bar, a traditional robata grill, an alluring dining room and sake lounge as well as three private dining rooms and chef counter seating. An extensive offering of proprietary sakes, wine and signature cocktails complement the menu, making this a destination for connoisseurs of libations as well as discerning epicurians.

description.text:
Join us for an evening bridging the gaps between Art, Entertainment, and Social Affairs... 
  
Fee Sheet Society and Blood, Sweat, Tears, & Ink present 
  
"THE GOLDEN MEAN" 
  
HOSTED BY  
Keef Brown 
FEATURING 
D'dra White 
Darth Tone  
Dom Jones 
Hazel Rose 
Melina Jones 
Michael Wayne Turner III 
Rich City Stu 
Vell Taylor 
MUSIC BY  
Realthoughtz 
  
Thursday, May 26th. Doors open 7:30PM Showtime 8:00PM 
Tickets: $15 in advance, $20 at the door  
21+ ID Required 
Level 13 (Formerly Shadow Ultra Lounge) 341 13th st. Oakland Ca 94612 

KEEF BROWN  
Keef Brown is a 29 year old MC from Richmond, California. An alumnus of Grambling State University, this master craftsman when writing and performing is a self proclaimed contemporary urban griot with a penchant for words of purpose who places a premium on the craft of English language arts. He has been writing and performing since 2008 and just recently began displaying his battle rap skills in competitions throughout the Bay Area. This explosive artist brings heat to every microphone he steps to and is guaranteed to leave you with a little piece of his soul once he spits his last word. 

D'DRA WHITE  
Writer, Poet, Spoken Word Artist D'dra White is the breath of fresh air you didn’t know you were missing. Armed with a smile, and the knowledge that this is her calling, D’dra is an empath, using poetry to tell the stories of those who forgot that they had a story to tell. In the slam/spoken word arena, she has enjoyed some successes: 

Member of the 2009 San Francisco Slam Team (which finished 3rd in the Nation) and the only member of the team to perform individual pieces in every round of competition. 
Winner of the 2010 "School of Slam" invitational. 
Founding Member of the Bay Area All-Stars (the first Bay Area writing collective to tour Hawaii). 
Cohost/Curator/Slammaster of an Award nominated Open mic/Slam (Golden State Slam and Open-mic). 
One of five women poets selected to perform on Season Two of Verses and Flow (the only season the show was nominated for an NCAAP Image Award). 
D'dra has performed all over the country and shared the stage with notable talents like Anthony David, Prentice Powell, Sonya Renee Taylor, and Talaam Acey to name a few. 
When not on stage, D'dra can be found mentoring and teaching spoken word classes for young people while rocking the flyest of earrings. 

DARTH TONE  
Darth Tone is an emcee from the Biggest Little Town in the world, Reno, Nevada. He possesses a style wholly original and unique to himself. When in the booth under the imprint of Vaded Nation he is calm, reflective, and introspective. However within the emcee battle culture, Tone turns vicious with a lyrical prowess marked by witty wordplay and aggressive delivery. 


DOM JONES  
 
Dom Jones, from Oakland CA, is a 2nd semester voice principal at the prestigious Berklee College of music in Boston. A ferocious emcee, Dom is also an impressive singer/songwriter. An International Songwriting Competition Winner in 2014, Dom released her first album, Wingspan that same year. In addition to writing for The Berklee Groove, Dom is a 2016 Writing Fellow for Forbes 30 under 30 recognized publication, Blavity. More about her work in music, media, and journalism can be found at iamdomjones.com 

HAZEL ROSE  
Hazel Rose is a versatile performing artist who combines live electronic music with raw emotional and spiritual energy. Born and raised in San Francisco, her message fiercely inspires change, ranging from lyrical Hip Hop, to synthy House to live band Funk and Dancehall. Her live performance includes Mic Angelo (talkbox/keyboard) and Stylo (Ableton Push/Guitar/Percussion). Her debut solo album “The Seed” dropped in Spring of 2015 and new Mixtape “The 5th Element” followed by her next full-length album “9 Lives” are set to release in 2016. 


MELINA JONES Melina Jones sports a double life:  Designer by day, Wordsmith come night . . . all beautifully sculpted from a body of experiences, creative inheritances, and pure courage. 
Her delivery assaults listeners with maximum impact and multi-faceted content, replete with lyrical prowess. Floating from hardcore lioness, to sweet-hearted lamb at the speed of sound, San Francisco's native daughter has every intension of softly brutalizing—AND saving you at the same time. Accruing over 10 years as a craftswoman in the rap game has generated a performance roster of legendary Hip-Hop artists, including Mobb Deep, Mos Def (Yasiin Bey), Jean Grea, Redman, DJ Premier (Gang Starr), Pep Luv (Hieroglyphics), and Spinderella (Salt-n-Pepa), to name a few. With roots planted in San Francisco, Jones’s dexterity as ­a Mistress of Ceremonies informed her full-length debut album entitled "SWEARING OFF BUSTERS", which seduced a ton of fanatics back in 2007, anointing her as one of The Bay Area’s most beloved and sought after MCs. Jones is currently crafting her sophomore album, "HEROINE", dropping Spring 2014. Thanks to her father’s influence (local Soul/Jazz vocalist Ernest East), song-writing and lyricism are embossed in her chromosomes. Joined by the design process—our confidently-humble lyricist leads her audience to a destination of talents, while exhibiting her gifts amidst the dead space of sonic mediocrity: well-crafted lyrics immersed in critical thought and fervent passion, delivered with conviction and intent. Stage presence? An energy that is positively infectious. 

MICHAEL WAYNE TURNER III 
 

Michael Wayne Turner III lives in Oakland was born in Houston stop by Brooklyn bloomed in Spring moved to San Francisco got educated down the hill graduated to Hollywood trained for a year; toured the country for two and who knew he’d be here today.    Michael the Third is an award winning writer, poet, spoken word artist, actor, dancer, emcee, and choreographer. A Scholar and a Gentleman. A innovator and educator. Michael’s genius approach to his artistry is both captivating, and explosive. Michael walked his talents to the world at the brave age of 8 on stage with Destiny’s Child.Michael moon walked on the screen with  Planet Funk on Good Morning America at the age of 13. Since then it has been evident the renaissance the man embodies. Such have acknowledged: Russell Simmons, Youth Speaks, Stan Lathan and HBO’s Brave New Voices, Marc Bamuthi Joseph, the National Performing Network, Mapp International, and the International Performing Arts Conference.Drafted into the professional circuit of performing arts right out of high school. Since, Michael Wayne Turner III has performed and lead workshops in his dedicated field  in over 50 cities and hundreds of schools throughout the United States. Theaters such as the Majestic Theater, The Manship Theater in the Shaw Center, The Public Theater, San Francisco War Memorial Opera House, Herbst Theater, Greek Theater, The Public Theater NY and The Chicago Theater to name a few. Constantly involved with what’s relevant  in performance, Michael is currently touring Marc Bamuthi Joseph's reincarnation of “WORD BECOMES FLESH” (a five man sixty minute hip-hop theatrical), in which he is used to write, speak, dance, and act in what the "Washington Post" notes as a "theoretical theatrical smackdown"; as being featured in New York’s “Time Out” magazine.  As an educator and facilitator of the art-education, Michael has developed a framework for engaging young people with his art through an educational lens, enabling the personal narrative to have a voice.Providing this service in high school all through out the bay area, to colleges such as UCLA,USC, Stanford University, University of San Francisco, LSU, LAVC, UCB, Murray State, TSU, WKU, University of Kansas, EKU, MTSU, The University of Iowa, Millersville University  and Columbia College of Chicago.  Michael lives to provide this service to the world. A true pioneer of his craft.   

RICH CITY STU Rich City Stu, born and raised in Richmond, CA., started producing tracks at the early age of 15. He found swift, smooth, edgy style, with a fly but hood swagger behind the Mic at the age of 19. His circumstances started to curve the focus of his music and that's when the attention started to come. Pushing forward with Rubberband Clan, Stu has been rapidly releasing new music to create a buzz for he and his team. His passion and drive has allowed him to perform alongside, Tyga, Doughboyz Cashout, Kevin Gates, Mistah Fab, Cyhi the Prince, Nipsey Hussle, and many more. Be on the the look out for more from Stu and the Rubberband Clan.  

VELL TAYLOR  
Vell Taylor is Oakland, California, through and through. He’s not “from” West Oakland. In fact, he embodies it. Oakland is a most unique city incomparable to any other. So the same is Vell’s prowess on the microphone. What does he sound like? He sounds like a BART station on a Monday morning, like Lake Merrit on a Sunday afternoon, like Oracle Arena when the Warriors are home. If this were an essay, this would be the point where proof would be provided for claims made. Vell Taylor’s latest EP is entitled “Hella”. The previous project “S.O.D.A” exclusively samples music from R&B titans, and Oakland natives Tony! Toni! Toné! If this were an essay, this would be the portion where you provided with a proposition going forward. Here, it’s simple. Get familiar.

description.text:
The Eastlake Music Festival (EMF) is a FREE nonprofit music and arts festival for ALL AGES on Lake Merritt in Oakland, California. EMF presents the best local, independent musicians, artists and performers in and around Oakland, California. Two large stages, a brand new music maker lounge, microbrews, food trucks, and free fun for the whole family...there's something for everyone at EMF 2016! 

"Did you know that each year nearly 100 volunteers donate time, resources, and good old fashioned hard work to put on the festival for FREE, for ALL AGES for the people of Oakland." 

Evermore so, the arts are facing severe defunding across large institutions, devaluation through condensed mp3's online, and funding cuts for classroom art programs. Increasingly, fewer and fewer children, particularly in Oakland, get a chance to feel the dynamic rush, energy and magnetic appeal of a live instrument, band or vocalist beyond the four corners of their computer or smartphone screen.  
At our core, we believe live music and performance arts shouldn't be a luxury for the few, rather accessible to everyone. In order to achieve this mission, we finance this nonprofit live music and performance art project annually through crowd funding and donations. After all, this is a festival for the people, by the people! 
So if you have the means to give the gift of music to your fellow citizens and the children of the community, please help us by donating below. 
"Even a waterfall, starts with one drop." - The Power of One 
LINE UP WILL BE ANNOUNCED IN APRIL.

name.text: San Francisco Boys Chorus Spring Concert with SONOS at Cathedral of Christ The Light--A TRIBUTE TO MADI BACON
name.html: San Francisco Boys Chorus Spring Concert with SONOS at Cathedral of Christ The Light--A TRIBUTE TO MADI BACON

description.text:
A TRIBUTE TO MADI BACON 
  
Join the SFBC and world renowned bellringing ensemble SONOS to raise the rafters with sound in the glorious space of Oakland's Cathedral of Christ the Light as they pay tribute to SFBC founder MADI BACON and celebrate her life of teaching joy to youngsters through music, education and nature. Featuring a new work by SONOS director Jim Meredith and music to uplift everyone's heart for summer. 
  
An event not to be missed! 
Purchase your tickets in advance! 
 

Since 1948! 
 The Grammy Award-winning San Francisco Boys Chorus has  
offered top quality performance experience and musical training  
to boys in the San Francisco Bay Area  since 1948.  
 
The Cathedral of Christ the Light Center holds delightful treasures  
for anyone on a journey of discovery, or for those who come back again and again.  
Tours of the Cathedral are offered one hour prior to the concert for $5 per person.  
For more information about the tour or other events, visit www.ctlcathedral.org. 
    
  
 VIEW SEATING CHART 
FAQs 
What are the ticket options?    
The ticket prices purchased on this Eventbrite website are advanced purchase prices.  Tickets prices are separated by seating sections in the Cathedral (Orchestra and General) and by Adult and Seniors 65 & over/Children 12 and under.  Tickets purchased on the day at the event door will be $5 more.  
What are the seating options?    
Please see the seating chart and the restricted view seating for this concert's seating options.  Reservations are for sections only, not exact seats.  Kindly negotiate seating with other reserved patrons in your row. 
Where is Accessible Seating? 
Accessible Seating is available on the aisle of the section ticket is purchased for.   Let us know if you need any assistance.  
What are my transport/parking options getting to the event? 
We recommend you arrive early to allow for parking.  There is plenty of street parking.  The are garages near by that offer paid parking.  Entrance is on 21st Street. 
BART: The 19th Street BART station is located approximately six blocks from The Cathedral of Christ the Light. Weekend schedules are often different than weekday schedules. For route maps and schedules, go to www.bart.org. 
BUS: AC Transit lines 11 and 12 stop at the corner of Grand Avenue and Harrison Street. Weekend schedules are often different from weekday schedules. For route maps and schedules, go to www.actransit.org. 
Where can I contact the organizer with any questions? 
www.sfbc.org 
info@sfbc.org 
Is my ticket transferrable? 
Yes.   Sorry, no refunds or exchanges on any tickets. 
Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event? 
Yes.  All tickets will be scanned before entry to the concert so please arrive early.  
The name on the registration/ticket doesn't match the attendee. Is that okay? 
Yes

"Continuing in the same direction as the EP—putting a contemporary spin on classic, vibrant 1970s urban soul—the track and video focuses more on the ebullience of the music, making for an upbeat, effervescent track." [PopMatters.com]   
"Jordan’s sweet vocal tone and positive message only get better with a satisfying crescendo during the bridge, which pops even more with the lush, live instrumentation." [SingersRoom.com] 
  
  
Jasmine Jordan: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8iNp_EXAc84  Current Personae: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nu0bJhYRWoA  Joomanji: http://joomanjimusic.com/   
  
  
DOORS 9PM SHOW 10PM 21 & Up  Price: $10 Advance 
 THE UPTOWN CLUB 1928 Telegraph Ave, Oakland, California (just 1 block from 19th Street BART!)

description.text:
Maryland Deathfest presents: 
California Deathfest II 
This is an ALL-AGES event. 
Tickets are specific to you (or your guests) and can only be redeemed once for a wristband at the event. Tickets will NOT be sent through normal post. You can also scan your ticket using your smartphone at the gate.  You will receive multiple printable tickets if you purchase multiple tickets.  
Yes you can transfer tickets at any time.  Please see Eventbrite's ticket transfer instructions for more information on how to transfer your ticket to another person. NOTE: Neither Eventbrite nor Maryland Deathfest are responsible for any third-party ticket sales. 
No refunds. All sales are final.
